item.title: Don't Trust the Cops: Sometimes Rubocop is Wrong
item.description: My team at work recently upgraded our version of Rubocop, the popular linter used to enforce good Ruby code style. With the upgrade we got a whole bunch of new suggestions and warnings about style violations. One of them that tripped us up was the Performance/Count rule. According to the Rubocop docs: This cop is used to identify usages of count on an Enumerable that follow calls to select or reject.
